View

Class CTS_GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • View.CTS_GUI

  • public class CTS_GUI
extends javafx.application.Application
    The GUI of the project. Generates a window that the user can interact with.
    Author:
    Joey McMaster, Nicholas Fiegel, Matt Theisen, Jackson

      • drawCircle

        public void drawCircle(int radius,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Draws a circle of the given radius, at the specific x,y location on the graphics context. x and y are absolute, relative to the upper left side of the rectangular view.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the circle
        x - The horizontal coordinate of the grid to put the circle center.
        y - The vertical coordinate of the grid to put the circle center.
        color - The color of the circle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the circle can not be fully displayed on the graphics context.

      • drawCircle

        public void drawCircle(double radius,
                       double x,
                       double y,
                       javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Draws a circle of the given radius, at the specific x,y location on the graphics context. x and y are absolute, relative to the upper left side of the rectangular view.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the circle
        x - The horizontal coordinate of the grid to put the circle center.
        y - The vertical coordinate of the grid to put the circle center.
        color - The color of the circle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the circle can not be fully displayed on the graphics context.

        Parameters:

      • adjustObserverLocationByClick

        private void adjustObserverLocationByClick(int dir,
                                           double offset)
        Takes a direction int, (1 - 4) and offset value. Moves the latitude and longitude. If dir is invalid, resets the latitude and longitiude to 0.
        Parameters:
        dir - (1 - 4) indicates direction.
        offset - The amout to be moved latitude wise (longitude is moved 4x this).

      • getUserInputFromUIControls

        private double[] getUserInputFromUIControls()
        Grabs info stored in the UI controls and translates to a series of doubles.
        Returns:
        An array of length 9 with the first 2 values being latitude and longitude The 3,4 and 5 being Year,Month,Day The 6,7 and 8 being Hour,Minute,Second 9 being an error code: 0 = NO ERROR 9 = Bad latitude, 10 = Bad longitude, 11 = bad date, 12 = bad time

      • getCheckBoxes

        private boolean[] getCheckBoxes()
        Fetches the status of the check boxes in the GUI.
        Returns:
        A boolean array indicating if CheckBoxes are ticked or not.

      • validateInput

        private long validateInput()
        Validates input found in the main settings menu input feilds.
        Returns:
        The error code. 0 is no error.

      • getPositionOfSpaceObject

        private double[] getPositionOfSpaceObject(CTS_SpaceObject obj)
        Determines where to plot space objects on the graph. Returns null if fails.
        Parameters:
        obj - A space object with defined azimuth and altitude fields.
        Returns:
        A set coordinates for the graph.

      • resetSkyDrawing

        private void resetSkyDrawing()
        Resets the state of the graphics context for redrawing.

      • magnitudeToRadius

        private double magnitudeToRadius(double mag)
        Converts an objects magnitude to a radius to be displayed at
        Parameters:
        mag - The magnitude of the object.
        Returns:
        The radius it will apear as on screen.

      • distanceToCenterOfDisplay

        private double distanceToCenterOfDisplay(double x,
                                         double y)
        Determines the distance from the given x,y values to the center of screen.
        Parameters:
        x - The x postion of the start point.
        y - The y postion of the start point.
        Returns:
        The distance between the x,y pair and the x,y pair at the center of screen.

        Parameters:
        in - A string of length 1 or higher. Does not error check.
        Returns:
        The string with its first letter capitalized.
